availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis C. Stinson (Vanderburgh County, Indiana, attorney)

body.p: Vanderburgh County, Indiana, attorney. Indiana native. Married to Martha E. Dunning Stinson in Monroe County, Indiana, on January 27, 1852. Father of Harris Stinson, Mary Stinson, and James Stinson. Attorney in Warrick County, Indiana, in 1850. Attorney in Vanderburgh County in 1860. Attorney in Vanderburgh County in 1863. Attorney in Vanderburgh County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Warrick County, Boonville, p. 97B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Evansville, p. 451.
Indiana Marriage Records, 1818-1921, Indiana Archives and Record Administration, Circuit Court Clerk, Bloomington, Indiana. Monroe County, Indiana, Marriage Records, volume B, 1840-1852, p. 24.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Vanderburgh County, IN, June 1863, p. 263.
Williamsâ€™ Evansville Directory, for 1865, (Evansville: E.J. Dobell, 1863), p. 155.
